title: Leave the Cooking to Someone Else—Serve These Thanksgiving Looks Instead
description: Some come for the food; I come for the fashion.
excerpt: Some come for the food; I come for the fashion.
text: What do I love most about Thanksgiving? Let me think...food, family, football, fashion—no, that wasn’t a slip of my keyboard. Fashion! While some might disagree, I like to think every day as my runway, and the feast-filled holiday is no exception. With that spirit in mind, I pulled together a shoppable mood board of the best Thanksgiving outfits. Who says the holiday has to be reduced to frumpy sweaters and tired colors? Below, you’ll find a bit of everything: gorgeous suede bags, elevated knitwear, trending colors and prints, unexpected accessories, and tons of inspiration to create the perfect fall ensemble. In my opinion, if you have to argue about politics, answer questions about your love life (or lack thereof), or bump into an ex in your hometown, you might as well look fabulous while doing so. Ahead, see everything I’ll be wearing this November. Trendy FringeRaimonda KulikauskieneThe fringe! The leather! The drama! Make an entrance in a frilly piece with lots of movement and body. Add in a chunky boot, like my favorite pair below.AllSaints Pip BootNow 25% OffShashi Odyssey EarringsAritzia Tabloid Trench CoatTod's Swing BagNow 26% OffAlanui Monsoon Fringed Maxi Dress Oliver Peoples Davri SunglassesMenswear InspiredClaudio LaveniaKeeping with that theme, you don’t have to rock a form-fitting outfit for the big meal. Opt for dramatic and oversized silhouettes, and lean into the color of the season with a delicious chocolate brown hue. Bonus points for layering a white tee underneath; find my absolute favorite one below. Two seemingly different pieces somehow work so well together.Adorn Pili Gloria Pearl CrossToteme Off-White Collarless Cinched JacketLittle Liffner Pillow Hobo SuedeBy.Dyln Juno ShortsVallon Surf AviatorsTony Bianco Drax Zebra Tie It Together Christian VierigI didn’t expect the necktie to become my favorite accessory this season, but there’s something so powerful about them that really draws me in. It’s also a very simple way to bring pattern and color to a muted or monochrome look.Zegna Silk TieAlex Mill Val ShirtAlmada Label Nola Turtleneck SweaterLe Specs Beachcomber SunglassesThe Frankie Shop Tansy Pleated TrousersMadewell Chunky Metal Leather BeltA Statement CoatRaimonda KulikauskieneGo incognito under a big, beautiful coat. These are perfect for secretly running to the grocery or wine store in your pajamas. No one has to know what’s underneath. Max Mara Album Collarless Cashmere Long CoatDonni The Rib TurtleneckMunthe Leather SkirtParis Texas 60MM Suede Mid-Calf BootsTom Ford Square-Frame SunglassesStudio Amelia Black Aurora ClutchHead-to-Toe DenimChristian VierigAs a staunch fan of Canadian tuxedos, this look is really doing it for me. A loose denim set paired with a suede clog is so elevated yet so comfortable.Toteme Denim OvershirtIcon Denim Hailey JeansParker Thatch Lee BagVeronica Beard Fern Shearling ClogAIRE Whirlpool SunglassesGabriel & Co. 14K Yellow Gold Bujukan Open BanglePass the Cranberry Edward BerthelotWhen I’m in a food coma, the only thing I want to be wearing is something roomy. My tip is to sport loose clothes in an on-trend color or fabric. Cranberry is about as thematic as you can get for Thanksgiving. I usually shy away from the color purple, but it works really well here.Ducie Magda Suede JacketNaadam Cashmere SweaterCOS Pleated Barrel-Leg Cotton PantsPrada Sculpted-Frame SunglassesBlack Suede Studio Arrow LoafersStaud Brando Black BagSimple CardiganChristian VierigIf you want to take a more understated route, a high-quality sweater and sleek pant is really all you need. Your basics don’t have to be boring! Leset Yoko Pocket Pant MÉGA Large Donut EarringsThe Row Belvedere Bucket BagTheory Crewneck CardiganAgmes Jean CuffBy Anthropologie Micro Pumps Western TwistRaimonda KulikauskieneI call this one “cowgirl chic.” I couldn’t resist adding a modern bolo tie and silver-trimmed snip toe boots to bring the look together. Oh, and Miu Miu hair clips to match, of course.Milkwhite Faux Leather Oversized JacketFree People Baggy High-Rise JeansFree People Brayden Western BootAnnika Inez Vertical Bolo NecklaceBuck Mason Mainstay Cotton ShirtMiu Miu Hair ClipsOld Favorites Edward BerthelotStill loving that piece you wore last spring? html:
What do I love most about Thanksgiving? Let me think...food, family, football, fashion—no, that wasn’t a slip of my keyboard. Fashion! While some might disagree, I like to think every day as my runway, and the feast-filled holiday is no exception. With that spirit in mind, I pulled together a shoppable mood board of the best Thanksgiving outfits.

Who says the holiday has to be reduced to frumpy sweaters and tired colors? Below, you’ll find a bit of everything: gorgeous suede bags, elevated knitwear, trending colors and prints, unexpected accessories, and tons of inspiration to create the perfect fall ensemble. In my opinion, if you have to argue about politics, answer questions about your love life (or lack thereof), or bump into an ex in your hometown, you might as well look fabulous while doing so. Ahead, see everything I’ll be wearing this November.

Trendy Fringe

The fringe! The leather! The drama! Make an entrance in a frilly piece with lots of movement and body. Add in a chunky boot, like my favorite pair below.

AllSaints Pip Boot

Now 25% Off

Shashi Odyssey Earrings

Aritzia Tabloid Trench Coat

Tod's Swing Bag

Now 26% Off

Alanui Monsoon Fringed Maxi Dress

Oliver Peoples Davri Sunglasses

Menswear Inspired

Keeping with that theme, you don’t have to rock a form-fitting outfit for the big meal. Opt for dramatic and oversized silhouettes, and lean into the color of the season with a delicious chocolate brown hue. Bonus points for layering a white tee underneath; find my absolute favorite one below.

Lemaire High Neck Sweatshirt

Filippa K Darcey Wool Trousers

Steve Madden Dreaming Leopard Flats

Bottega Veneta Long Andiamo Leather Clutch

FM 669 Little Organic Cotton T-Shirt

Banana Republic Topstitched Leather Belt

Bermuda Beauty

I've been loving styling a loose short with a feminine heel. Two seemingly different pieces somehow work so well together.

Adorn Pili Gloria Pearl Cross

Toteme Off-White Collarless Cinched Jacket

Little Liffner Pillow Hobo Suede

By.Dyln Juno Shorts

Vallon Surf Aviators

Tony Bianco Drax Zebra

Tie It Together

I didn’t expect the necktie to become my favorite accessory this season, but there’s something so powerful about them that really draws me in. It’s also a very simple way to bring pattern and color to a muted or monochrome look.

Zegna Silk Tie

Alex Mill Val Shirt

Almada Label Nola Turtleneck Sweater

Le Specs Beachcomber Sunglasses

The Frankie Shop Tansy Pleated Trousers

Madewell Chunky Metal Leather Belt

A Statement Coat

Go incognito under a big, beautiful coat. These are perfect for secretly running to the grocery or wine store in your pajamas. No one has to know what’s underneath.

Max Mara Album Collarless Cashmere Long Coat

Donni The Rib Turtleneck

Munthe Leather Skirt

Paris Texas 60MM Suede Mid-Calf Boots

Tom Ford Square-Frame Sunglasses

Studio Amelia Black Aurora Clutch

Head-to-Toe Denim

As a staunch fan of Canadian tuxedos, this look is really doing it for me. A loose denim set paired with a suede clog is so elevated yet so comfortable.

Toteme Denim Overshirt

Icon Denim Hailey Jeans

Parker Thatch Lee Bag

Veronica Beard Fern Shearling Clog

AIRE Whirlpool Sunglasses

Gabriel & Co. 14K Yellow Gold Bujukan Open Bangle

Pass the Cranberry

When I’m in a food coma, the only thing I want to be wearing is something roomy. My tip is to sport loose clothes in an on-trend color or fabric. Cranberry is about as thematic as you can get for Thanksgiving.

Massimo Dutti Strappy Midi Slip Dress

Paris Texas Roxy 35mm Leather Boots

Skims Relaxed Zip Up Hoodie

COS Oversized Quilted Crossbody

Damson Madder Tie Neck Bonnet

N.Peal Ribbed Cashmere Scarf

Bright Pop

As someone who truly lives in dark colors, adding a bright base layer brings contrast, depth, and life to a look. I usually shy away from the color purple, but it works really well here.

Ducie Magda Suede Jacket

Naadam Cashmere Sweater

COS Pleated Barrel-Leg Cotton Pants

Prada Sculpted-Frame Sunglasses

Black Suede Studio Arrow Loafers

Staud Brando Black Bag

Simple Cardigan

If you want to take a more understated route, a high-quality sweater and sleek pant is really all you need. Your basics don’t have to be boring!

Leset Yoko Pocket Pant

MÉGA Large Donut Earrings

The Row Belvedere Bucket Bag

Theory Crewneck Cardigan

Agmes Jean Cuff

By Anthropologie Micro Pumps

Western Twist

I call this one “cowgirl chic.” I couldn’t resist adding a modern bolo tie and silver-trimmed snip toe boots to bring the look together. Oh, and Miu Miu hair clips to match, of course.

Milkwhite Faux Leather Oversized Jacket

Free People Baggy High-Rise Jeans

Free People Brayden Western Boot

Annika Inez Vertical Bolo Necklace

Buck Mason Mainstay Cotton Shirt

Miu Miu Hair Clips

Old Favorites

Still loving that piece you wore last spring? Don’t store it away just yet. Instead, throw a turtleneck underneath, and pair it with a dark jean. Suddenly, you’ve transformed your piece from one season to the next.

Rejina Pyo Perrin Single-Breasted Blazer

Aligne Iris Detachable Roll Neck Jumper

Everlane The Way-High Curve Jean

Jeffrey Campbell Jeffrey CampbellGratis Hardware Detail Satin Mules

Now 50% Off

Eileen Fisher Textured Italian Leather Shopper Tote

Comme Si The Cashmere Sock

Leather Trench

Why not make bring some hot attitude to the table? You might not have contributed much in the kitchen, but this green frock and zebra bag are a feast for the eyes.

St. Agni Leather Trench Coat

Asta Resort Natalia Dress

Simkhai Sylvie Heel

Alessandra Rich Pyramid Earrings with Crystals

Loewe Aviator Sunglasses

Núnoo Dandy Brown Stripes Bag

Silk & Sheer

While I probably wouldn’t choose this look to spend the holiday with grandparents or in-laws, this combination of a silky tunic and semi-sheer maxi would be beyond perfect for friendsgiving.

Proenza Schouler Bond Bag

Lily Silk Silk Top

MANGO Openwork Stitch Maxi Sweater Dress

Saint Laurent Carine Slingback Pumps

Heaven Mayhem Beverly Earrings

Elisa Johnson Lori Sunglasses

Layered Dressing

If you can’t decide whether you want to dress up or down, throwing a fun tee or rugby shirt under a dress is the perfect solution. When in doubt, layer.

Ganni Jacquard Strap Midi Dress

Ganni Long Sleeve Polo Shirt

Ganni Feminine Buckle Ballerinas

Ganni Funny Heart Logo-Print Coin Purse

Santos Amelia Mini Baguette

Otiumberg Roscida Drop Hoop Earrings

Cow Print

It seems like every stylist I follow on Instagram has been sporting this cowhide jacket, so they must be onto something. Wear it over a plain white tank and pants to give it the moment it truly deserves.

Mango Fur-Effect Leather Jacket

Artless Forever Linen Relaxed Pants

Now 95% Off

Rag & Bone The Essential Rib Scoop Neck Tank

RAYE Cait Sandal

Bottega Veneta Mini Jodie Intrecciato Leather Bag

Anine Bing Roma Sunglasses

Knit Dress

Sometimes less is more, so a simple blazer thrown over a white dress works effortlessly. In case you’re spending your first big occasion with a significant other’s family, you can’t go wrong with this look. Impress them with style, and it’ll be smooth sailing (hopefully).

A.L.C. Fawn Ruched Column Gown

Maje Double-Breasted Wool-Blend Felt Coat

Saint Laurent Calypso Patent Leather Shoulder Bag

Mejuri Puffy Charlotte Pearl Drop Earring

Chimi Black Glasses

Vince Isabel Leather Flat

Why Trust ELLE

We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
